intro: Isaura, commonly known as the blue-eyed Mary, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Isaura typically grows in well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant colors and compact growth habit.
